dataset.title: Total numbers and species of insects taken from the Kuparuk River rock scrubbings during the summer of 1984-1988, Arctic LTER 1984 to 1988.

abstract.para: Total numbers and species of insects taken from the Kuparuk River rock scrubbings during the summer of 1984-1988.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications

A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:
Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The Kuparuk River in arctic Alaska, approximately 3 km south and 1 km north of the river crossing at the Dalton Highway (68 38'15"N, 149 25'30"W).

description.para:
Log of changes:
Data received from Jim Lee and Karie Slavik in 2004.

For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: March 9, 2004 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Adrian Green DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Adrian Green DATE: March 9, 2004

para.literalLayout: A rock-scrubbing technique was used to collect bottom samples at several different stations with three replicates at each station in the Kuparuk River. The stations are measured relative to the 1984 phosphorus dripper. Only July sampling dates are included in this file (ACG). The samples were preserved in ethanol then picked, sorted, counted, and measured in Duluth using a NIKON MICRO-PLAN II digitizing pad.

Notes: These data were received from Jim Lee via Karie Slavik, and entered by Adrian Green, March, 2004. No chironomid data is available for 1985 and 1986. 84-92 samples taken from rock in ref. and fert zones.

SITE Kuparuk River y STREAM TYPE tundra stream SAMPLE TYPE Benthic DATE date DD-MMM-YY n STATION distance from 1984 dripper meters n TRIAL repetition number n RHYAC number of Rhyacophila n blank BRACHY number of Brachycentrus n blank NATARSIA number of Natarsia n blank ORTHO number of Orthocladius n blank OTHCHIR number of other chironomids n blank CHIPUPA number of Chironomid pupae n blank BLACK number of Black Flies n blank BLKPUPA number of Black Fly pupae n blank BAETIS number of Baetis n blank BAETSP3 number of Baetis "species 3" n blank EPHEM number of Ephemerella n blank CINYG number of Cinygmula n blank NEMOURA number of Nemoura n blank TIPULA number of Tipula n blank SNAILS number of Snails n blank
